alert.note: Alert for Tidal Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 7:31PM EDT until September 09 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.9 to 8.1 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Southern Berkeley County including Daniel Island. * WHEN...Until 11 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Water may cover some roads and encroach on yards on Daniel Island. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 8:13 PM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Tidal Berkeley SC MLLW Categories - Minor 8.0 ft, Moderate 8.5 ft, Major 9.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.2 ft, Moderate 2.7 ft, Major 3.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/08 PM 8.0 2.2 1.2 N/A None 10/08 AM 7.0 1.2 0.9 N/A None 10/09 PM 7.5 1.7 0.8 N/A None 11/09 AM 6.9 1.1 0.6 N/A None 11/10 PM 7.0 1.2 0.5 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
